result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M Bailey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 60 days at the House of Correction consecutive to time now being served; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by  12-30-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Sentence will be served in the Wisconsin State Prison system. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amened charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended  Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Christopher M Bailey in court with attorney Craig J Johnson.  Defendant Christopher M Bailey in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clekr;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court AMENDS the charge to Possession of Tetrahydrocannabinols (THC) 961.41(3g)(e) an unclassified misdemeanor.

Attorney Craig J Johnson in court, defendant Christopher M Bailey not in court, in custody.  Kevin R Shomin for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant is in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Craig J. Johnson in court, defendant Christopher M Bailey not in court, in custody.  William Levins for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant is in custody serving a revocation sentence.  Attorney Johnson needs to obtain records from the probation officer and medical records.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-26-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher M Bailey in court with attorney Craig J. Johnson.  Defendant Christopher M Bailey in custody.  Stephan Nolten, appearing for Nathaniel Emery Adamson, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with St. Lukes Hospital; Melissa B or Vernon L

Defendant Christopher M Bailey in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Christopher M Bailey in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
